trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN Gateway in the Azure Portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN Gateway in the Azure Portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article walks you through configuring your virtual network VPN gateway and changing a VPN gateway routing type from static to dynamic or dynamic to static.
trans-unit.target: This article walks you through configuring your virtual network VPN gateway and changing a VPN gateway routing type from static to dynamic or dynamic to static.

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN gateway in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN gateway in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a secure cross-premises connection between Azure and your on-premises location, you'll need to configure a VPN gateway.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a secure cross-premises connection between Azure and your on-premises location, you'll need to configure a VPN gateway.

trans-unit.source: There are different types of gateways and the type of gateway you'll create depends both on your network design plan, and the on-premises VPN device you want to use.
trans-unit.target: There are different types of gateways and the type of gateway you'll create depends both on your network design plan, and the on-premises VPN device you want to use.

trans-unit.source: For example, some connectivity options, such as a point-to-site connection, require a dynamic routing gateway.
trans-unit.target: For example, some connectivity options, such as a point-to-site connection, require a dynamic routing gateway.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure your gateway to support both point-to-site (P2S) connections and a site-to-site (S2S) connection, you'll have to configure a dynamic routing gateway even though site-to-site can be configured with either gateway routing type.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure your gateway to support both point-to-site (P2S) connections and a site-to-site (S2S) connection, you'll have to configure a dynamic routing gateway even though site-to-site can be configured with either gateway routing type.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you'll have to make sure the device you want to use for your site-to-site connection will support the gateway type that you want to create.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you'll have to make sure the device you want to use for your site-to-site connection will support the gateway type that you want to create.

trans-unit.source: See [About VPN Gateways](vpn-gateway-about-vpngateways.md).
trans-unit.target: See [About VPN Gateways](vpn-gateway-about-vpngateways.md).

trans-unit.source: Configuration overview
trans-unit.target: Configuration overview

trans-unit.source: The procedure below will walk you through configuring your VPN gateway in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The procedure below will walk you through configuring your VPN gateway in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: These steps apply to gateways for VNets that were created using the Service Management mode and are visible in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: These steps apply to gateways for VNets that were created using the Service Management mode and are visible in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: They are not the steps for using the Preview Portal or for VNets configured using the Resource Manager mode.
trans-unit.target: They are not the steps for using the Preview Portal or for VNets configured using the Resource Manager mode.

trans-unit.source: You can find information about creating VNet gateways for virtual networks created using the Resource Manager mode in [Create a virtual network with a site-to-site connection using Azure Resource Manager and PowerShell ](vpn-gateway-create-site-to-site-rm-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: You can find information about creating VNet gateways for virtual networks created using the Resource Manager mode in [Create a virtual network with a site-to-site connection using Azure Resource Manager and PowerShell ](vpn-gateway-create-site-to-site-rm-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: Before you configure your gateway, you'll first need to create your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Before you configure your gateway, you'll first need to create your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For steps to create a virtual network for cross-premises connectivity, see [Configure a virtual network with a site-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md), or [Configure a virtual network with a point-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: For steps to create a virtual network for cross-premises connectivity, see [Configure a virtual network with a site-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md), or [Configure a virtual network with a point-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).

trans-unit.source: Then, use the steps below to configure the VPN gateway and gather the information you'll need to configure your VPN device.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the steps below to configure the VPN gateway and gather the information you'll need to configure your VPN device.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a VPN gateway and you want to change the routing type, see [How to change your VPN gateway type](#how-to-change-your-vpn-gateway-type).
trans-unit.target: If you already have a VPN gateway and you want to change the routing type, see [How to change your VPN gateway type](#how-to-change-your-vpn-gateway-type).

trans-unit.source: Create a VPN gateway
trans-unit.target: Create a VPN gateway

trans-unit.source: Gather information for your VPN device configuration
trans-unit.target: Gather information for your VPN device configuration

trans-unit.source: Configure your VPN device
trans-unit.target: Configure your VPN device

trans-unit.source: Verify your local network ranges and VPN gateway IP address
trans-unit.target: Verify your local network ranges and VPN gateway IP address

trans-unit.source: Create a VPN gateway
trans-unit.target: Create a VPN gateway

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal,on the **Networks** page, verify that the status column for your virtual network is **Created**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal,on the **Networks** page, verify that the status column for your virtual network is **Created**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** column, click the name of your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** column, click the name of your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** page, notice that this VNet doesn't have a gateway configured yet.
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** page, notice that this VNet doesn't have a gateway configured yet.

trans-unit.source: You'll see this status as you go through the steps to configure your gateway.
trans-unit.target: You'll see this status as you go through the steps to configure your gateway.

trans-unit.source: Gateway Not Created
trans-unit.target: Gateway Not Created

trans-unit.source: Next, at the bottom of the page, click **Create Gateway**.
trans-unit.target: Next, at the bottom of the page, click **Create Gateway**.

trans-unit.source: You can select either *Static Routing* or *Dynamic Routing*.
trans-unit.target: You can select either *Static Routing* or *Dynamic Routing*.

trans-unit.source: The routing type you select depends on a number of factors.
trans-unit.target: The routing type you select depends on a number of factors.

trans-unit.source: For example, what your VPN device will support and whether you need to support point-to-site connections.
trans-unit.target: For example, what your VPN device will support and whether you need to support point-to-site connections.

trans-unit.source: Check [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md) to verify the routing type that you need.
trans-unit.target: Check [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md) to verify the routing type that you need.

trans-unit.source: Once the gateway has been created, you can't change between gateway types without deleting and re-creating the gateway.
trans-unit.target: Once the gateway has been created, you can't change between gateway types without deleting and re-creating the gateway.

trans-unit.source: When the system prompts you to confirm that you want the gateway created, click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: When the system prompts you to confirm that you want the gateway created, click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: Gateway Type
trans-unit.target: Gateway Type

trans-unit.source: When your gateway is creating, notice the gateway graphic on the page changes to yellow and says *Creating Gateway*.
trans-unit.target: When your gateway is creating, notice the gateway graphic on the page changes to yellow and says *Creating Gateway*.

trans-unit.source: It may take up to 25 minutes for the gateway to create.
trans-unit.target: It may take up to 25 minutes for the gateway to create.

trans-unit.source: You'll have to wait until the gateway is complete before you can move forward with other configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: You'll have to wait until the gateway is complete before you can move forward with other configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Gateway Creating
trans-unit.target: Gateway Creating

trans-unit.source: When the gateway changes to *Connecting*, you can gather the information you'll need for your VPN device.
trans-unit.target: When the gateway changes to *Connecting*, you can gather the information you'll need for your VPN device.

trans-unit.source: Gateway Connecting
trans-unit.target: Gateway Connecting

trans-unit.source: Gather information for your VPN device configuration
trans-unit.target: Gather information for your VPN device configuration

trans-unit.source: After the gateway has been created, gather information for your VPN device configuration.
trans-unit.target: After the gateway has been created, gather information for your VPN device configuration.

trans-unit.source: This information is located on the **Dashboard** page for your virtual network:
trans-unit.target: This information is located on the **Dashboard** page for your virtual network:

trans-unit.source: **Gateway IP address -** The IP address can be found on the **Dashboard** page.
trans-unit.target: **Gateway IP address -** The IP address can be found on the **Dashboard** page.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to see it until after your gateway has finished creating.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to see it until after your gateway has finished creating.

trans-unit.source: **Shared key -** Click **Manage Key** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: **Shared key -** Click **Manage Key** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click the icon next to the key in order to copy it to your clipboard, and then paste and save the key.
trans-unit.target: Click the icon next to the key in order to copy it to your clipboard, and then paste and save the key.

trans-unit.source: Note that this button only works when there is a single S2S VPN tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Note that this button only works when there is a single S2S VPN tunnel.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple S2S VPN tunnels, please use the Get Virtual Network Gateway Shared Key API or PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple S2S VPN tunnels, please use the Get Virtual Network Gateway Shared Key API or PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Manage Key
trans-unit.target: Manage Key

trans-unit.source: Configure your VPN device
trans-unit.target: Configure your VPN device

trans-unit.source: After completing the previous steps, you or your network administrator will need configure the VPN device in order to create the connection.
trans-unit.target: After completing the previous steps, you or your network administrator will need configure the VPN device in order to create the connection.

trans-unit.source: See [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md) for more information about VPN devices.
trans-unit.target: See [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md) for more information about VPN devices.

trans-unit.source: After the VPN device has been configured, you can view your updated connection information on the Dashboard page for your VNet.
trans-unit.target: After the VPN device has been configured, you can view your updated connection information on the Dashboard page for your VNet.

trans-unit.source: You can also run one of the following commands to test your connection:
trans-unit.target: You can also run one of the following commands to test your connection:

trans-unit.source: Cisco ASA
trans-unit.target: Cisco ASA

trans-unit.source: Cisco ISR/ASR
trans-unit.target: Cisco ISR/ASR

trans-unit.source: Juniper SSG/ISG
trans-unit.target: Juniper SSG/ISG

trans-unit.source: Juniper SRX/J
trans-unit.target: Juniper SRX/J

trans-unit.source: Check main mode SAs
trans-unit.target: Check main mode SAs

trans-unit.source: show crypto isakmp sa
trans-unit.target: show crypto isakmp sa

trans-unit.source: show crypto isakmp sa
trans-unit.target: show crypto isakmp sa

trans-unit.source: get ike cookie
trans-unit.target: get ike cookie

trans-unit.source: show security ike security-association
trans-unit.target: show security ike security-association

trans-unit.source: Check quick mode SAs
trans-unit.target: Check quick mode SAs

trans-unit.source: show crypto ipsec sa
trans-unit.target: show crypto ipsec sa

trans-unit.source: show crypto ipsec sa
trans-unit.target: show crypto ipsec sa

trans-unit.source: get sa
trans-unit.target: get sa

trans-unit.source: show security ipsec security-association
trans-unit.target: show security ipsec security-association

trans-unit.source: Verify your local network ranges and VPN gateway IP address
trans-unit.target: Verify your local network ranges and VPN gateway IP address

trans-unit.source: Verify your VPN gateway IP address
trans-unit.target: Verify your VPN gateway IP address

trans-unit.source: For gateway to connect properly, the IP address for your VPN device must be correctly configured for the Local Network that you specified for your cross-premises configuration.
trans-unit.target: For gateway to connect properly, the IP address for your VPN device must be correctly configured for the Local Network that you specified for your cross-premises configuration.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this is configured during the site-to-site configuration process.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this is configured during the site-to-site configuration process.

trans-unit.source: However, if you previously used this local network with a different device, or the IP address has changed for this local network, you'll want to edit the settings to specify the correct Gateway IP address.
trans-unit.target: However, if you previously used this local network with a different device, or the IP address has changed for this local network, you'll want to edit the settings to specify the correct Gateway IP address.

trans-unit.source: To verify your gateway IP address, click **Networks** on the left portal pane and then select **Local Networks** at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: To verify your gateway IP address, click **Networks** on the left portal pane and then select **Local Networks** at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the VPN Gateway Address for each local network that you have created.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the VPN Gateway Address for each local network that you have created.

trans-unit.source: To edit the IP address, select the VNet and click **Edit** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: To edit the IP address, select the VNet and click **Edit** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify your local network details** page, edit the IP address, and then click the next arrow at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify your local network details** page, edit the IP address, and then click the next arrow at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify the address space** page, click the checkmark on the lower right to save your settings.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify the address space** page, click the checkmark on the lower right to save your settings.

trans-unit.source: Verify the address ranges for your local networks
trans-unit.target: Verify the address ranges for your local networks

trans-unit.source: For the correct traffic to flow through the gateway to your on-premises location, you'll need to verify that you have listed each IP address range that you want to include in your local network configuration.
trans-unit.target: For the correct traffic to flow through the gateway to your on-premises location, you'll need to verify that you have listed each IP address range that you want to include in your local network configuration.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the network configuration of your on-premises location, this can be a somewhat large task because each range must be listed in your Azure **Local Networks** configuration.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the network configuration of your on-premises location, this can be a somewhat large task because each range must be listed in your Azure **Local Networks** configuration.

trans-unit.source: Traffic that is bound for an IP address that is contained within the ranges listed will then be sent through the virtual network VPN gateway.
trans-unit.target: Traffic that is bound for an IP address that is contained within the ranges listed will then be sent through the virtual network VPN gateway.

trans-unit.source: The IP address ranges that you list do not have to be private ranges, although you will want to verify that your on-premises configuration is able to receive the inbound traffic.
trans-unit.target: The IP address ranges that you list do not have to be private ranges, although you will want to verify that your on-premises configuration is able to receive the inbound traffic.

trans-unit.source: To add or edit the ranges for a Local Network, follow the procedure below.
trans-unit.target: To add or edit the ranges for a Local Network, follow the procedure below.

trans-unit.source: To edit the IP address ranges for a local network, click **Networks** on the left portal pane and then select **Local Networks** at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: To edit the IP address ranges for a local network, click **Networks** on the left portal pane and then select **Local Networks** at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, the easiest way to view the ranges that you've listed is on the **Edit** page.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, the easiest way to view the ranges that you've listed is on the **Edit** page.

trans-unit.source: To see your ranges, select the VNet and click **Edit** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: To see your ranges, select the VNet and click **Edit** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify your local network details** page, don't make any changes.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify your local network details** page, don't make any changes.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify the address space** page, make your network address space changes.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify the address space** page, make your network address space changes.

trans-unit.source: Then click the checkmark to save your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Then click the checkmark to save your configuration.

trans-unit.source: How to view gateway traffic
trans-unit.target: How to view gateway traffic

trans-unit.source: You can view your gateway and gateway traffic from your Virtual Network **Dashboard** page.
trans-unit.target: You can view your gateway and gateway traffic from your Virtual Network **Dashboard** page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** page you can view the following:
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** page you can view the following:

trans-unit.source: The amount of data that is flowing through your gateway, both data in and data out.
trans-unit.target: The amount of data that is flowing through your gateway, both data in and data out.

trans-unit.source: The names of the DNS servers that are specified for your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The names of the DNS servers that are specified for your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: The connection between your gateway and your VPN device.
trans-unit.target: The connection between your gateway and your VPN device.

trans-unit.source: The shared key that is used to configure your gateway connection to your VPN device.
trans-unit.target: The shared key that is used to configure your gateway connection to your VPN device.

trans-unit.source: How to change your VPN gateway type
trans-unit.target: How to change your VPN gateway type

trans-unit.source: Because some connectivity configurations are only available for certain gateway types, you may find that you need to change the gateway type of an existing VPN gateway.
trans-unit.target: Because some connectivity configurations are only available for certain gateway types, you may find that you need to change the gateway type of an existing VPN gateway.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may want to add point-to-site connectivity to an already existing site-to-site connection that has a static gateway.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may want to add point-to-site connectivity to an already existing site-to-site connection that has a static gateway.

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site requires a dynamic gateway, which means in order to configure it, you'll have to change your gateway type from static to dynamic.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site requires a dynamic gateway, which means in order to configure it, you'll have to change your gateway type from static to dynamic.

trans-unit.source: If you need to change a VPN gateway routing type, you'll delete the existing gateway, and then recreate it with the new routing type.
trans-unit.target: If you need to change a VPN gateway routing type, you'll delete the existing gateway, and then recreate it with the new routing type.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to delete the entire virtual network in order to change the gateway routing type.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to delete the entire virtual network in order to change the gateway routing type.

trans-unit.source: Before changing your gateway type, be sure to verify that your VPN device will support the routing type that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Before changing your gateway type, be sure to verify that your VPN device will support the routing type that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: To download new routing configuration samples and check VPN device requirements, see [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md).
trans-unit.target: To download new routing configuration samples and check VPN device requirements, see [About VPN Devices for Virtual Network Connectivity](vpn-gateway-about-vpn-devices.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you delete a virtual network VPN gateway, the VIP assigned to the gateway is released.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When you delete a virtual network VPN gateway, the VIP assigned to the gateway is released.

trans-unit.source: When you recreate the gateway, a new VIP will be assigned to it.
trans-unit.target: When you recreate the gateway, a new VIP will be assigned to it.

trans-unit.source: Delete the existing VPN gateway.
trans-unit.target: Delete the existing VPN gateway.

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** page for your virtual network, navigate to the bottom of the page and click **Delete Gateway**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** page for your virtual network, navigate to the bottom of the page and click **Delete Gateway**.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the notification that the gateway has been deleted.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the notification that the gateway has been deleted.

trans-unit.source: When you receive notification on the screen that your gateway has been deleted, you can then create a new gateway.
trans-unit.target: When you receive notification on the screen that your gateway has been deleted, you can then create a new gateway.

trans-unit.source: Create a new VPN gateway.
trans-unit.target: Create a new VPN gateway.

trans-unit.source: Use the procedure at the top of the page to create a new gateway: [Create a VPN gateway](#create-a-vpn-gateway).
trans-unit.target: Use the procedure at the top of the page to create a new gateway: [Create a VPN gateway](#create-a-vpn-gateway).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about Virtual Network cross-premises connectivity in this article: [About secure cross-premises connections for virtual networks](vpn-gateway-cross-premises-options.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about Virtual Network cross-premises connectivity in this article: [About secure cross-premises connections for virtual networks](vpn-gateway-cross-premises-options.md).

trans-unit.source: You can add virtual machines to your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can add virtual machines to your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: See [How to create a custom virtual machine](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-create-custom.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to create a custom virtual machine](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-create-custom.md).

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure a point-to-site VPN connection, see [Configure a point-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure a point-to-site VPN connection, see [Configure a point-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).
